content.description: A interesting first move that is the hardest part of the climb. Move up utilizing the crack system that you start in. This route only utilizes the wall to the left for the first foot move.
content.location: the far left side of the wall where the main wall meets a small head height wall, using a crimp about a foot into the crack, the undercling, and a smeer start up the short crack system.

content.description: BE CAREFUL OF NEEDLES NEAR THE CAVE! Cool start with a lack of feet, start is the hardest part
content.location: to the right of Frye Sauce, left hand in a triangular pocket at about head height

content.description: A cool basalt wall right across the river from Mckay Park. The wall is about 15 feet tall with a cool crack system in the rock but everything even the boulders on top seem to be sturdy. It should be noted that the cave to the right has seen homeless/druggies and should be avoided until its cleaned up. Until then, only two routes have been established.
